nav6.externalsitedescription: The only wine club that makes wine a matter of taste: yours. Join TPNStwo Wine Club by Greek Wine Company to start the experience.

columnists.columnistcovers: Politics, public opinion and social justice.
columnists.columnistbio:
Nico Haitas has been a TPNStwo Opinion Editorial columnist since 2008. His column appears on Monday and Thursday.

Mr. Haitas joined TPNStwo in 1994 as a graphics editor and quickly became the paper’s graphics director, a position he held for nine years. In that role, he led TPNStwo to a best of show award from the Society for News Design for TPNStwo’s information graphics coverage of 9/11, the first time the award had been given for graphics coverage. He also led the paper to its first two best of show awards from the Malofiej Infographics World Summit for work that included coverage of the Iraq war. Mr. Haitas became the paper’s design director for news before leaving in 2006 to become the art director of National Geographic magazine. Before joining TPNStwo, Mr. Haitas had been a graphic artist at The Athenian News.

Mr. Haitas is the author of “My Super Book”, released in September 2014. He graduated magna cum laude from Some University in Athens, where he received a B.A. in mass communications. He lives in Athens and has three children.

Eleni Nikologlou has been a TPNStwo Art and Photography Editorial columnist since 2008. She column appears on Monday and Thursday.

Ms. Nikologlou joined TPNStwo in 1994 as a art editor and quickly became the paper’s art director, a position she held for nine years. In that role, she led TPNStwo to a best of show award from the Society for News Design for TPNStwo’s information graphics coverage of 9/11, the first time the award had been given for art coverage. She also led the paper to its first two best of show awards from the Malofiej Art World Summit for work that included coverage of the Iraq war. Ms. Nikologlou became the paper’s art director for news before leaving in 2006 to become the senior art director of National Geographic magazine. Before joining TPNStwo, Ms. Nikologlou had been a Fine Art Photographer at The Athenian News.

She graduated magna cum laude from Some University in Athens, where she received a B.A. in mass communications. She lives in Athens and has three children.

series.seriescovers: Essays, art and opinion exploring the lives of people living with disabilities.
Fixes looks at solutions to social problems and why they work.
Dispatches from college students, professors and administrators on higher education and university life. You can reach the editors at oncampus@tpnstwo.com.
Exploring the history and legacy of Communism, 100 years after the Russian Revolution.
Personal essays about athletics, games and exercise by participants and observers alike.
A forum for contemporary philosophers and other thinkers on issues both timely and timeless. The series moderator is Joe Bloggs, who teaches philosophy at Some School for Social Research.
